task.title: Creating a Pipeline and Defining Pipeline Properties
task.shortdesc: When you configure a pipeline, you need to decide what to do with error records. You can discard them, write them to file, or write them to Kafka.

context.p: This tutorial writes the records to a local file, but if you prefer to write error records to Kafka, feel free.

step.cmd: If you aren't already, log in to the .
In the New Pipeline window, enter a pipeline name and optional description, and click Save.
step.info: Will retake screenshot - new icons and Tucu rewrote the Creation_009 error message for me.At the top of the canvas, the Pipeline Creation Help Bar indicates that the origin is missing and offers a list of origins to choose from. On the right, the stage library displays a list of available origins. You can use the drop-down menu to change the stages that display.

step.cmd: In the Properties panel, click the Error Records tab. And for the Error Records property, select Write to File.
Click the Error Records - Write to File tab and configure the following properties:

row.entry: Directory for error record files. Enter the directory that you set up for the tutorial.To prevent validation errors, the directory must already exist.

This defines a prefix for error record files.
Delete the default and enter "err_".
Let's reduce the files size to something more managable, such as 5 or 1 MB.
